channel.title: Tattoo's
channel.description:
What's your personal opinion on tattoo's?
Do you hate them?
Would you get one?
Do you have one?
I just got mine today.
[img]http://sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc4/hs240.snc4/39336_1352784459428_1225904944_30819071_2063947_n.jpg[/img]
It says Karma

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

kronikz:

how’d that almost kill you?

Severed several veins as well as an artery along with blood thinners.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

I suppose its time to bring this thread back to life. Yesterday I got a tattoo on my wrist to cover up a scar that almost killed me. A rather symbolic cover up…

For the record I am a hippie not a hipster.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I plan to get sleeve tattoos for both of my arms. I don’t know what I want yet, but I want it to be colorful. I won’t be getting it all done at the same time, I want to start with my right wrist and go up.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Anyone who says tattoos don’t hurt are lying and are trying to act big in my opinion. My back piece was probably the sorest thing I’ve had to go through when it reached 45 minutes to an hour in and as you can imagine I’ve experienced quite a few sore things throughout the muay thai career, moreso in mma because of grapples and holds. I honestly am dreading going back to get more done just because I know the pain’s gonna be there lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

It’s going to be finished soon.

@whoever said their brother said tattoos don’t hurt.

it depends where you get them. My wrist, elbow, and inner arm hurt like hell. The one on my shoulder which goes into my armpit also hurt. The worst part about this tattoo was the scales getting colored in 1 days after the outline.

Read full topic

It doesn’t no, any order.

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Ruby:

I didn’t bother with any after care kit or anything like that, I just used Bepanthen gel which is actually used for nappy rash (for babies) but really keeps the skin moist and took a lot of the itch out of it. I wouldn’t leave the skin to go dry but I have a lot of friends who have and theirs have turned out fine. It’s just personal preference I suppose.

Ah, I’ve heard that it affects how long the the color holds in your skin and prevents infection. But, whatever works for you and keeps you from not having an infection man :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I didn’t bother with any after care kit or anything like that, I just used Bepanthen gel which is actually used for nappy rash (for babies) but really keeps the skin moist and took a lot of the itch out of it. I wouldn’t leave the skin to go dry but I have a lot of friends who have and theirs have turned out fine. It’s just personal preference I suppose.

Read full topic

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:153, topic:353136”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=639649.msg4313457#msg4313457 date=1371086951]
My brother just got one on his chest (tattoo), he says that the pain people claim they are is nothing like it actually is. The worst part is when it starts to dry and peel. Not sure if that’s your first tattoo or not, but DO NOT scratch it. I’m sure your parlor will explain what you need to do after, but definitely make sure it doesn’t dry out.
[/quote]what he is trying to say is this…

Guys…take more than just your Saturday night bath![/quote]
Lol, definitely. I would suggest an actual Tattoo aftercare kit, possibly from amazon.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

My brother just got one on his chest (tattoo), he says that the pain people claim they are is nothing like it actually is. The worst part is when it starts to dry and peel. Not sure if that’s your first tattoo or not, but DO NOT scratch it. I’m sure your parlor will explain what you need to do after, but definitely make sure it doesn’t dry out.

item.title: Tattoo's
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

I’m wanting to have the traditional koi fish colors. Getting it colored tomorrow. 4 hours under a needle is a bit tiring, not because it hurts but because I couldnt sit still. XD

I’m going to have this whole arm a Japanese themed, scaled replica of a koi pond or whatever you call them. Vibrant with colors and detail.

Read full topic
